data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Controlled Photoinduced Generation of “Visual” Partially and Fully Charge Separated States in Viologen Analogues

data.question: Who is the corresponding author of the article?
data.answer: Ming-Sheng Wang

data.question: What is the main objective of the study mentioned in the article?
data.answer: The main objective is to capture a photoinduced partially charge separated (PCS) state with a lifetime of days and control the photoinduced generation of PCS and fully charge separated (FCS) states by molecular design.

data.question: What method was used for the synthesis of [Zn(OAc)2(bipy)]n (1)?
data.answer: The method reported in reference 5 was used for the synthesis.

data.question: What instruments were used for the UV–vis spectra recording?
data.answer: PerkinElmer Lambda 900 UV/vis/Near-IR spectrophotometer equipped with an integrating sphere was used.

data.question: Is the compound [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) a new compound according to the article?
data.answer: Yes, [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) is a new compound according to the article.

data.question: What was the temperature used for the X-ray crystallographic study of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2)?
data.answer: The temperature used was 293 K.

data.question: What was the yield of the synthesis of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) based on bipy?
data.answer: The yield was greater than 80%.

data.question: Did the compound [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) undergo a two-step color change after irradiation according to the article?
data.answer: Yes, the compound underwent a two-step color change after irradiation.

data.question: What was the purpose of using isobutyric acid and Zn2(OH)2CO3·H2O in the synthesis of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2)?
data.answer: Isobutyric acid and Zn2(OH)2CO3·H2O were used as starting materials for the synthesis of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2).

data.question: Was the phase purity of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) confirmed by PXRD patterns?
data.answer: Yes, the phase purity of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) was confirmed by PXRD patterns.

data.question: What was the method used for the X-ray crystallographic study of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2)?
data.answer: The method used was single-crystal X-ray diffraction measurement.

data.question: What was the space group of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) according to the article?
data.answer: The space group was C2/c.

data.question: Did the article mention the use of a specific software for PXRD pattern simulation?
data.answer: Yes, Mercury Version 2020.1 software was mentioned for PXRD pattern simulation.

data.question: What was the role of the EPR spectrometer in the study?
data.answer: The EPR spectrometer was used to measure electron paramagnetic resonance data for the compounds.

data.question: Was thermal annealing used in the study for any purpose?
data.answer: Yes, thermal annealing was used to accelerate the color change from yellow to purple for compound [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2).

data.question: What was the significance of the Raman spectra in the study?
data.answer: Raman spectra were used to reveal the charge-separation processes between the compounds.

data.question: Was the compound [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) stable at room temperature according to the article?
data.answer: Yes, the compound was stable at room temperature.

data.question: What was the purpose of using the easyspin package in MATLAB according to the article?
data.answer: The easyspin package was used for EPR spectral simulations.

data.question: Did the article provide any information on the thermal stability of [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2)?
data.answer: Yes, the article mentioned that [Zn(IBA)2(bipy)]n (2) can stabilize to at least 150 C.
